programme.desc: When an old pal of Torres' comes to him -- disheveled and bloodied -- for guidance amidst an undercover FBI operation and then disappears, NCIS helps track him down; McGee prepares to be a contestant on a popular game show.

programme.desc: When a patient dies after a hit-and-run accident, Toby discovers that the man was convicted of embezzling millions of dollars.

programme.desc: A widow hires Bull when the police decide she is a suspect in her wealthy husband's death.

programme.desc: When Atwater goes under cover to bring down the longtime head of a criminal enterprise, he becomes entangled in a situation that tests his allegiances as well as his conscience.

programme.desc: Upton and Burgess find themselves in a difficult situation when Intelligence tracks a cache of cop killer machine guns to a local gun show in Wisconsin.

programme.desc: A mayoral candidate is shot by an unidentified sniper, and Intelligence races to catch the shooter before he can take out his next target.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence's investigation into the murder of Burgess' boyfriend threatens to reveal a dark side she was unaware of; the real motivation for his murder uncovers a much more unsettling truth.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A violent crew is hitting pharmaceutical delivery trucks and stealing drugs, but their motivation is more complicated than just money; the case tests Upton and Ruzek's relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Antonio struggles with his guilty conscience as he tries to take down a major drug dealer; Voight takes a shot at Kelton to protect his team.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: With Kelton's election all but assured, Voight and his team must go off-book in a last-ditch effort to save Intelligence from getting axed.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Kelton is found murdered, Voight's grudge against the mayor-elect puts him under suspicion; Upton and Halstead are eager to prove their sergeant's innocence, but the more evidence they gather, the closer they come to doing the opposite.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Atwater goes undercover in a drug syndicate, he learns there may be more to its kingpin than meets the eye; Halstead tries to join Atwater undercover, but finds himself at a disadvantage; Voight petitions the brass to show Ruzek leniency.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is a big fan and old friend of Buzz MacClaine, a popular mystery writer, and the author asks the private eye to help edit his latest work. When Buzz meets his own violent end, Mike Hammer takes on the case to find the killer. But in this case, life seems to imitate art. Hammer and his team realize that his manuscript is filled with clues to an actual crime, and they must decode the mystery novel in order to find Buzz's killer.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: There's more than just paint on the walls when Mike tries to help Velda after her boyfriend, an artist, is murdered in his studio before an exhibition. But Hammer struggles to connect the dots in this mysterious case, and a long list of suspects emerges when he discovers that the artist often made others see red. Could it be the artist's jealous ex, the wealthy art collector, the corrupted art critic, the gallery owner, or even Velda herself?

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Hammer's on-again off-again flame is a Broadway star named Linda Fortunato, but her latest role is as primary suspect in the murder investigation of her ex-husband and co-star. The whole city is convinced of her guilt after the spatting couple was seen fighting during rehearsals, but Mike Hammer is determined to clear her name. Drama and mystery unfold while Hammer investigates a whole cast of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After being released from his time in prison, Mike Hammer's old friend Herman Simpson joins him for dinner. The discussion turns techie when Simpson brings up the computer revolution that is underway. However, a bank robbery involving this same technology-- and a suspiciously similar criminal --takes place the same evening. Simpson becomes the prime suspect, and Hammer is his only hope at staying free.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike's journalist friend, Pete, misses their scheduled meeting. But the apparent suicide raises questions that lead Mike to follow up on Pete's latest investigative assignment, an exposé on surveillance. Hammer finds out that Pete was writing about the shadows and powers behind modern surveillance, an entity known as Big Brother. Now Hammer must track down the killer that's always watching everybody.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team tries to establish Kensi Blye's innocence after she is accused of murdering one of the colleagues of her now-deceased father.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team searches for evidence of Kensi's innocence after a meeting involving her father's sniper unit turns deadly.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When a man is shot outside of the Vietnamese Consulate, the team must find out if the incident was an act of terrorism.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When evidence in a Navy intelligence officer's death points to a team of SEALs about to embark on a mission, Sam must interrogate the group, potentially compromising their operation.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Brett and Foster question the suspicious circumstances surrounding an attack at a juvenile detention center; a convoluted new technology at Firehouse 51 tests everybody's patience; Kidd is chosen to represent the district at a leadership conference.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A rare but deadly bacteria takes its toll on numerous victims around the city, leaving Chicago's finest first responders to work together alongside the CDC to resolve the dangerous situation; Severide suspects something bigger is happening.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Kidd must prove herself at the National Firefighter Leadership Conference, while the rest of Firehouse 51 is called to two eerily similar car wrecks; Mouch tries to keep the firehouse informed by starting a newsletter; Cruz deals with a heartbreak.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Cruz and Severide suspect foul play when a fire started by an elderly woman turns deadly. Kidd, Foster and Brett create a women's-only lounge. Firehouse 51 celebrates some good news.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide must make a tough decision about the future of his career at Firehouse 51; Herrmann deals with the consequences of his temper; Cruz is excited to demonstrate the Slamigan at the Firefighting Expo; Commissioner Grissom returns.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide starts off on the wrong foot at his Office of Fire Investigation assignment when, despite orders, he reopens an old case; Herrmann is on a mission to discover what caused an apartment fire; Kidd finds herself burning the candle at both ends.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: An unexpected visit throws Casey for a loop; Severide sets out to exonerate a wrongly convicted arsonist; Kidd pays the price for burning the candle at both ends; Cruz goes on a mission to fix one of Otis's old toys.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Members of Firehouse 51 are dismayed to learn their boundaries have been redrawn to overlap with an adjacent station, and problems quickly arise; Casey and Gallo hunt a missing piece of equipment; Brett and Foster find themselves at odds.

Additionally, specific segments such as Today's Money, Today's Kitchen and Today Throws a Wedding target specific lifestyle issues, and the show's anchors frequently report on special themes from around the globe.

programme.desc: In 1994, baseball was on the verge of disaster. The 232 day strike canceled the World Series, cost the sport billions, and alienated a loyal fan base. But in 1995, one man did his part to help bring the sport back from the brink.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Big Papi was at his best when it mattered, heralded as the greatest playoff clutch hitter of all-time. Filmed over the course of just six weeks, David Ortiz: Legend Of The Fall documents the three time world champion's recent induction in the baseball Hall of Fame – capturing the lead-up to this momentous event, the actual ceremony and the afterglow of his enshrinement.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 1A of the 2004 WSOP Main Event is underway with Daniel Negreanu, Men "The Master" Nguyen, and John Hennigan on the feature table. Defending champion Chris Moneymaker kicks off his title defense, while several big names find themselves heading home early.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Coverage continues on Day 1B of the WSOP Main Event, and last year's runner-up Sammy Farha headlines the feature table along with John Juanda. Chris Ferguson and "Miami" John Cernuto then join the feature table action, as many poker pros hit the rail on Day 1B.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion
programme.desc: Rebel is hurt by a porcupine and Ricky gets help for him from a new southern doctor who just arrived in town.

programme.title: The Adventures of Champion

programme.title: The Cisco Kid

programme.title: The Texan

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: While sleeping by his campsite, Bill is startled by sounds of movement in the underbrush. He investigates and finds a young boy who is so frightened that he can't talk.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill Longley comes to the aid of Ramirez, a farmer who wants to plant peach trees when the local cattlemen object.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The $8300 Bill Longley earned for driving a herd of cattle to Mesa isn't in his hands for thirty seconds before two gunmen take his money and the bank's assets as well.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: After Longley is forced to kill a barfly that tried to shoot him in the back, he learns a quirk in the Montana law code.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: While escorting to prison the leader of a notorious gang, a sheriff and a deputy are attacked by the gang.

programme.title: The Texan

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: Yancy Derringer

Custer disregards Yancy's explanation that the weapons are from a different tribe than Pahoo's Pawnee. Meanwhile, Yancy discovers that he is being stalked by a Native American seeking revenge for a past wrong.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When Mississippi riverboats sink in record numbers, Yancy investigates if these shipwrecks are an act of sabotage. He joins aboard the Southern Belle, owned by a fiery redhead, which ends up being the latest victim in a suspicious string of wrecks. Yancy finds a connection between the murder of Charlie Webster and a dispatch key belonging to a ship pilot.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat's tailor, a political organizer in a New Mexico town, draws the ire of a casino owner who kidnaps the tailor when he tries to organize an effort to fight the crooked owner's gang.

programme.desc: Estevan plans to trap Zorro after being accused by the masked outlaw of courting Margarita for her father's fortune.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is threatened with hanging by a lynch party when some horses he has purchased in a neighboring town turn out to be stolen.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.desc: "Crash of the Moons" (1954) Science Fiction. Our hero fights evil in outer space. From the "Rocky Jones, Space Ranger" TV series.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Sidehackers" a k a "Five the Hard Way" (1969) Adventure. A motorcycle racer rejects the wrong woman and nearly pays with his life.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Emily's crew watch as the Doctor Mordrid defends Earth from the forces of evil, and Dr. Kabahl schemes to increase viewership.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The guys face off against Hercules once again as the strong man fights evil Queen Antinea to get his son back in Hercules and the Captive Women (1961). Joel and the Bots play with some lousy action figures and finally lay the Hercules series to rest.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The Mads turn up the heat with a sequel.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Blood Waters of Dr. Z" (1972) Horror. A Florida scientist turns into a walking catfish. With Marshall Grauer and Wade Popwell.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When the husband, Tao Chen, is shot to death by his wife Jun, she claims she pulled the trigger in self-defense when a drunken Tao came after her with a gun.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Jeffrey Ortiz, a mentally challenged man with the mental capacity of a nine-year-old, is making himself a sandwich when he inexplicably falls, striking his head on the kitchen counter.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Teenagers stumble across a horrifying car fire on the side of a desolate stretch of roadway. When the police arrive, they pull severely burned human remains from the driver's seat.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Recent college grad Robert Terrible is out drinking at a club with friends celebrating. At 3am, he realizes he better call it a night and heads to the nearby garage where he parked his car.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Rusty Updike has asked his ex-wife Vesta on a cruise. The couple haven't seen each other for 15 years but Vesta decides that a cruise with her ex might make for a nice change of pace.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: On a Texas highway, a fire is discovered having burnt three bodies beyond recognition. Dr. G finds bullets in the bodies and determines that they were all shot before being set on fire.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A quadriplegic woman loved by her community is found dead in an Orlando park 150ft from her motorized wheelchair. Children find her lifeless body face down in the sand.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Chris Schaffer has not been seen or heard from in five days. Finally, his friends find him dead and decomposed in the driver's seat of his van.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An employee is found dead in a restaurant kitchen. Clues found near the body include an empty cash register, a knife and a trail of blood splotches leading to a vandalized car in the parking lot.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's a late night and a Vietnam veteran with a history of mental illness is drunk and stumbling through an apartment complex. When the police arrive, he pulls a gun and shoots himself in the head.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.desc: In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A diabetic man dies after a night out. Meanwhile, an elderly man's decomposing body is found in his son's home. Dr. G realizes that finding the causes of death will be anything but straight-forward.

programme.desc: Ricky Hawthorne, a middle-aged man with a history of AIDS, arrives at his local hospital complaining of chest pains. Doctors perform extensive tests on him but find nothing wrong and release him.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives tips on how to keep the garden looking good as well as how to maintain the vegetable plot for continuous crops. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein gives a comprehensive and seasonal guide to getting plants for free and this time she turns her attention to popular climbers like honeysuckle and clematis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty checks the progress of the potatoes he planted earlier in the year and recommends plants for dry shade under trees.We travel to Somerset to get water saving tips from a water scientist who uses a variety of techniques to save as much water as possible in her own garden and we meet a gardener who has filled his home with over one thousand houseplants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is in his garden, bringing viewers up to date on how it has been developing, as well as giving advice on growing hydrangeas. Toby Buckland shares his tips on dealing with damaged shrubs, tree pruning and transplanting perennials.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives more advice on tomato-growing, Nick Bailey travels to South Africa in search of the cousins of the Crocosmia, and Advolly Richmond looks at the Victorian trend of garden theme parks.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to stake dahlias, sows seeds of perennials and celebrates an abundant vegetable harvest. The team meet a landscape designer in Cornwall who creates gardens that are not only sustainable but also beautiful and edible.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plans for next spring when he plants some early-flowering wildflowers and gives his recipes for the different compost mixes he uses to take successful cuttings. Nick Bailey continues his quest for the South African origins of some much-loved summer bulbs, and in the heart of London, meet a keen gardener who has filled her houseboat with ornamental and edible plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Brighton determined duo Helen and Dax have their hands full with twins, one of whom has special needs. Meanwhile in High Wycombe, newly single Valerie is looking for a fresh lease of life.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re having a conversation with Zeb Hogan, the author, biologist, and television host known for his show "Monster Fish." In this episode, Hogan shares his experiences with the show, his upcoming book "Chasing Giants: In Search of the World's Largest Freshwater Fish," and his insights into the world of freshwater biology. Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: As a child, Piotr Chara spent countless hours on the Oder River in Poland, fishing with his father and wondering at the wildlife; as he grew, Piotr noticed a decline in the river’s bird species and decided to take action. Now an award-winning photographer - and a father himself - Piotr runs an organization that builds floating nests for the birds and restores the rapidly receding wetlands.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: This spring, Rivers are Life proudly partnered with The Little Forks Conservancy for a stream sampling event along Michigan’s Cedar River—a vital part of the watershed that eventually flows into Saginaw Bay.Held on May 17 at the Gladwin Conservation District’s Community Garden, the event brought together Citizen Scientists from across the state. Volunteers were divided into teams and sent to six different sites along the river to collect insect nymphs and larvae—tiny but mighty indicators of water health.Over 223 specimens were gathered, from stoneflies and mayflies to dragonfly larvae. These macroinvertebrates are highly sensitive to their environment, and their presence (or absence) can tell us a lot about the state of the river.The results? Based on initial identifications, the Cedar River shows signs of excellent water quality—making it one of Michigan’s prized Blue Ribbon Trout Streams.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Why do Rivers are Life impact projects matter? They support rivers around the world! And, the truth is, rivers need all the help they can get! Over 85% of people agree river pollution affects human health, yet many don’t know how to take action. Rivers Are Life is here to change that. Through education, awareness, and actionable solutions, we can improve water quality, protect ecosystems, and reduce waste.Join the movement to protect our rivers and ensure clean water for future generations. Together, we can make a real impact — it all starts with YOU.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The ability to overcome obstacles and challenging conditions can be key to success, but when fishing in Key West, cold temps are rarely the hurdle. programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Today we’re having a conversation with Zeb Hogan, the author, biologist, and television host known for his show "Monster Fish." In this episode, Hogan shares his experiences with the show, his upcoming book "Chasing Giants: In Search of the World's Largest Freshwater Fish," and his insights into the world of freshwater biology. Hogan's show "Monster Fish" takes viewers on a journey around the globe to explore the largest and most elusive freshwater fish in the world. programme.title: Saltwater Underground

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush takes up an invite from good friend and fellow guide Jared Cyr to sight fish for barracuda and bonefish in the shallow waters of the Florida Keys. Meanwhile Rush's boat takes a break from charter fishing to get a new Seakeeper RIDE system installed.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: After a great trip fishing the flats, Rush returns the favor and extends an invite to friend Jarred Cyr fishing offshore. Fishing in Key West is all about the variety of species and opportunities they present. Mixing it up and taking advantage of this, the guys decide to see how many species they can catch using light spin and fly tackle offshore.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The LK crew returns to Guatemala with more friends for our yearly dose of world class fishing! Year after year, Casa Vieja Lodge continues to impress with daily shots at sailfish, marlin, mahi, and tuna. Tag along on our 2nd annual group trip for a tropical fishing experience like no other!

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Sam Milazzo to find the elusive daytime Swordfish but run into some great Dolphin fishing on the way.

programme.title: saltwater experience
programme.desc: "Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor patiently pursue big tarpon from the Everglades to the Middle Keys with fly rod in hand."

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Richard Black for an exciting adventure in Key Largo, catching a wide variety of fish species on the shallow reef.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a frenzy of exciting Bluefish near Marathon, FL.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a productive wreck with which they enjoy the exciting variety of fish that wrecks can provide.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by marine scientist Nick Castillo to search for bonefish in Key Largo for both fun and study.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss explores the spartina creeks of St. Augustine, with the hopes of Landing a N.E. Florida slam!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everything—and the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and it’s bigger than ever. This time, we’re in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Florida’s most critical ecosystems. But it’s not just about hard work—it’s about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Don’t miss Part 1—where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.desc: After learning that his father is dying, karate master Mr. Miyagi (Noriyuki "Pat" Morita) returns home to Okinawa, bringing his protege, Daniel (Ralph Macchio), with him. In Japan, Miyagi is surprised to discover that his old sweetheart, Yukie (Nobu McCarthy), has remained single. Meanwhile, Daniel is attracted to Yukie's niece, Kumiko (Tamlyn Tomita). But romance must be put on hold while Daniel and Miyagi deal with local bullies and long-harbored grudges.

programme.title: A Knight's Tale
programme.desc: A peasant poses as a knight and enters a medieval jousting tournament in order to escape his humble roots and win the heart of a noble lady.

programme.title: The Last Dragonslayer
programme.desc: After finding that people are hunting the last dragon, an orphaned 15-year-old takes action to save it and the magical world they both inhabit.

programme.title: Crooked House
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Blue Thunder
programme.desc: Classic ‘80s action film about a police pilot who learns that the futuristic helicopter he’s testing could cause hellish destruction on U.S. citizens.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: During a hiking trip, the President's daughter gets kidnapped. Now it is up to Agent McGregor and a river guide to rescue her before it is too late.

programme.title: First Target
programme.desc: A group of deadly assassins targets the US President as he tours a state park aboard a tram, and it's up to Secret Service agent, Alex, to stop them.

programme.title: First Shot
programme.desc: A sniper's bullet has left the President in critical condition. Now a secret service agent must track down the terrorists behind the attack.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Tootsie
programme.desc: A talented, but temperamental and womanizing actor, who has antagonized every producer in NYC, needs money and plays the unlikely role of a lifetime.

programme.title: Hero
programme.desc: When her plane crashes into a Chicago bridge, ace reporter Gale Gayley is saved by a mysterious and unlikely hero in this heart-warming comedy.

programme.title: Family Business
programme.desc: A Westinghouse scholar recruits his criminal grandpa and reformed criminal dad to steal plasma from a research lab and share in the $1 million reward.

programme.title: About Last Night...
programme.desc: After Danny and his new girlfriend Debbie move in together, the two are bombarded with advice from their disapproving pals, Bernie and Joan.

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man before it is too late.

programme.title: Miracle on the Mountain: The Kincaid Family Story
programme.desc: Based on a true story, this film recounts a family's struggle for survival after their private plane crashes on their way to a cabin in the mountains.

programme.title: Places in the Heart
programme.desc: This stirring drama follows a widow as she struggles to raise her two children and save her Texas farm during the Great Depression.

programme.title: Brian's Song
programme.desc: Mekhi Phifer and Sean Maher star in the remake of the classic sports drama about two NFL contenders whose friendship is tragically cut short.

programme.title: Postcards From the Edge
programme.desc: A very real mother-daughter relationship and rivalry set against the backdrop of late 1980’s Hollywood. Based on Carrie Fisher's best-selling novel.

programme.title: Crooked House
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Agatha Christie.

programme.title: Wind Chill
programme.desc: On their way home for the holidays, two college students break down on a deserted road and are preyed upon by the ghosts of people who died there.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: A World War II classic about the violence, quarrels, and romantic intrigue affecting a group of soldiers at Pearl Harbor before the tragic attack.

programme.title: The Awful Truth
programme.desc: Jerry (Cary Grant) and Lucy (Irene Dunne) are a married couple who doubt each other's fidelity: Jerry suspects Lucy and her music teacher (Alexander D'Arcy) of spending an evening together, and Lucy is convinced Jerry lied about a business trip. When the jealous pair file for divorce, both rush into new relationships, but quickly realize their love never died. The soon-to-be-divorced husband and wife then both scramble to spoil each other's chances for newfound romance.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: Gidget (1959)
programme.desc: Things turn around for a sad-faced teen who can’t measure up to the chesty, bikini babes on the beach when two surfers start paying her attention.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: Tight Spot
programme.desc: A lawyer springs a wise-cracking model from jail to convince her to testify against a no-good mobster, but a besotted cop throws a wrench in the plan.

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: A fearless sailor returns to the kingdom of Thessaly after a 20-year voyage to find the Golden Fleece and make his rightful claim to the throne.

programme.title: Don't Knock the Twist
programme.desc: Dancers prepare for a TV special on the twist in this musical featuring performances of chart-topping hits from the heyday of rock 'n' roll.

programme.title: Three for the Show
programme.desc: Widowed by World War I, a Broadway star remarries her late husband's songwriting partner only to have the first one turn up very much alive.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: Berserk
programme.desc: Suspicions fall on the imperious ringmistress of a traveling circus when she appears unfazed by a series of mysterious and grisly murders.

programme.title: Scandal Sheet
programme.desc: After accidentally killing his ex-wife, an editor of a tabloid newspaper discovers that his ace reporters are investigating the story.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: Convinced they’re the first men on the moon, three astronauts discover evidence of a lunar landing decades earlier and track down its sole survivor.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.title: The Revenge Rider
programme.desc: A cowboy suspects a local cattleman's association is behind the murder of his brother, the sheriff.

programme.title: Last of the Comanches
programme.desc: A cavalry sergeant (Broderick Crawford) leads soldiers, civilians and an Indian (Johnny Stewart) on a desert trek.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: Thunderhoof
programme.desc: Two men and a young woman in the Mexican wilderness are intent on tracking down a wild stallion.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: The Revenge Rider
programme.desc: A cowboy suspects a local cattleman's association is behind the murder of his brother, the sheriff.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: South of Death Valley
programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to ease tensions between ranchers and miners over the cause of polluted water.

programme.title: Traveling Saleswoman
programme.desc: A soapmaker's daughter (Joan Davis) goes to the Wild West, followed by her boyfriend (Andy Devine).

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: A Lawless Street
programme.desc: The honorable Calem Ware (Randolph Scott), marshal of the Wild West boomtown of Medicine Bend, attempts to defuse the simmering tensions in his rapidly growing and increasingly violent town, as a greedy businessman (Warner Anderson) hires a sinister black-gloved gunman (Michael Pate) to take care of his problems with the marshal for good. Meanwhile, a traveling song-and-dance troupe arrives in town, bearing Ware's lost love, Tally (Angela Lansbury), who holds the secret to his violent past.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: Former Union soldier John Parrish (Glenn Ford) wants to sell his ranch and start a new life by settling down out east. However, the ruthless tactics of Lew Wilkison (Edward G. Robinson), the scheming businessman interested in his property, make Parrish reconsider the move, especially after one of his ranch hands is murdered. Adding to the increasingly tense conflict is Wilkison's wife, Martha (Barbara Stanwyck), who is cheating on her husband with his brother, Cole (Brian Keith).

programme.desc: Deputy Jess Carlin (Audie Murphy) leaves his Texas hometown in disgrace, framed by corrupt saloon owner Luke Starr (Broderick Crawford) for a crime he didn't commit. When his brother, muckraking newspaper editor Roy Carlin (Víctor Vilanova), is murdered after printing an exposé of Starr's crooked deals, Carlin returns home from the Mexican border town where he's been holed up and enlists his brother's fiancée (Luz Márquez) and saloon dancer Kit O'Neal (Diana Lorys) to bring Starr down.

programme.desc: One bank robber (David Brian) double-crosses another (Neville Brand), giving the undertaker and others a chance at the loot.

programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.desc: Ranchers in New Mexico have to face Indians and bandits.

programme.desc: A driver risks his sight when he boxes to pay for his brother's education.

programme.desc: Three prospectors fight off bandits and each other after striking it rich.

programme.title: Camelot
programme.desc: Arthur marries Guinevere, loses her to Lancelot and is forced into war.

programme.title: The Band Wagon
programme.desc: A Broadway artiste turns a film star's comeback vehicle into an artsy flop.

programme.title: Uptown Saturday Night
programme.desc: Two ordinary joes entangle themselves in an underworld mess.

programme.title: The Champ

programme.desc: Hard work aboard a fishing boat helps a spoiled rich boy become a man.

programme.desc: Danny and McGarrett try to solve their partnership issues with a couples retreat in Maui; Kamekona's past comes back to haunt him.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover goes to Chicago to get a confession from Clay Maxwell; Chin and Kono are held at gunpoint by people who don't know they are cops.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The members of Team Scorpion are asked to help NASA with a top-secret rocket launch, but they must sabotage their own mission when Walter's date finds a bomb strapped to her chest.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When a powerful earthquake hits Los Angeles, Team Scorpion must prevent a pinched gas line from causing a massive explosion.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must stop an influx of drugs that are being smuggled into the country via drones; an ultimatum is issued.

programme.title: Scorpion

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An erratic whistleblower who calls Pride her mentor kidnaps him to help her locate a serial killer targeting young women in the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.desc: The team joins forces with FBI Director Isler after a Russian operative with intelligence on sleeper agents disappears; Tammy partners with former sleeper agent Eva Azarova to assist in the disappearance.

programme.desc: FBI Special Agent Raymond Isler asks Pride for help with an off-the-books opioids theft investigation he is personally invested in; Percy works under cover as a getaway driver, with Isler as the muscle for a job tied to the case.

programme.desc: A congressional aide disappears after a hit man saves her from two men posing as NCIS agents; LaSalle struggles with life-altering decisions regarding his brother's future.
