programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A suspicious fire swept through an apartment killing two young women. The cause of the fire and the identity of the victims were unclear. But a closer look at the fire scene revealed something hidden in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For seven years, a trio of men robbed one bank after another. They always got away before the police arrived, and they left no evidence behind. But the way they stood and the clothes they wore told a story that could be read by forensic scientists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man died in his home after a long history of heart disease. It was assumed that this was the cause of his death. A few weeks after the funeral, rumors surfaced that the death was no accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is found dead in a ravine, but crucial crime scene evidence had been washed away by severe thunderstorms. Twice, the trail turned cold. Almost 20 years later, an old hat and a chip of stainless steel brought the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of a mail-order bride proves suspicious when detectives learn that two of the Texas husband's previous wives had died in mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A healthy young man dies mysteriously in his sleep, and toxicology tests reveal a lethal dose of lidocaine in his blood. Investigators find a suicide note, and presume he killed himself until a forensic linguist examines the note.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young TV news producer is raped and murdered in her apartment. Police identify two suspects, but both are cleared of any wrongdoing. The case stalls for more than a year, and then investigators turn to the Commonwealth of Virginia's DNA Databank.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A married couple decided to escape the cold of winter with a mini-vacation in Key West. The wife went missing, and police searched every square inch of the island; they found nothing but a pair of sandals which might have belonged to her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police are dispatched to the scene of a shooting, and discover the victim's husband is one of their own: a homicide detective who says his wife accidentally shot herself in the head.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man tells police he shot an intruder who had attacked and murdered his wife. The husband paints a tragic picture and is dubbed a hero. Four years later, forensic evidence leads police to re-examine the motives of this so-called hero.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police instituted an intense search when the mother of two young children went missing. Twenty years after finding her body, advances in technology enable investigators to see evidence in a new light, and discover it pointed directly to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: At a murder scene, investigators find a shoe-print, several foreign hairs, and unknown fingerprints. But they believe the most telling piece of evidence is the bite mark on the victim's chest.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of 9-year-old Jessica Knott is investigated. Investigators use a garbage bag to connect suspect James Edward Crow, Jr. to the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the state of Florida was known for more than just Disney World. Worldwide attention focused on a rash of robberies which targeted tourists. Some vacationers were killed in these attacks, but some fought and survived, despite severe injuries.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Haunted by the disappearance of her mother, a young woman undertook an investigation of her own. Her mother's diary was in the cold case file; there, she discovered a dark family secret, which might have been the reason her mother vanished.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The founder of American Atheists disappeared in 1995 along with one of her sons and granddaughter, along with $500,000 in gold coins. The police homed in on several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A talented television news anchor was shot to death outside her home; it appeared to be a crime of passion, perpetrated by an obsessed fan.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two eyewitnesses may hold the key to the death of a motorcycle gang member.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a young woman was found under an isolated ramp of the Interstate, and a tiny, unique fiber on the victim's clothing led San Diego police straight to the most unlikely of killers.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A neighbor watched as a man stabbed his wife, pushed her into the swimming pool and held her head under water. The husband, however, had no recollection of the crime. A jury would have to decide between evidence and the mysteries of the mind.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Computers aid the police and FBI in solving a string of crimes in St. Louis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: California police had several suspects in the robbery and brutal murder of an elderly couple. Ten years later, a determined forensic scientist used material from a dentist's office to uncover ballistic evidence which had been overlooked.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An unusual case involving the 1988 rape and murder of Nancy DePriest. After Chris Ochoa confessed, the case was closed. 8 years later, Achim Marino confessed to the same crime. DNA evidence cleared Ochoa while proving that Marino was the perpetrator.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Genell Plude is found dead in her bathroom, the scene points to suicide. But a coroner's inquest and a unique application of forensic science gave investigators a different explanation for her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a pipe bomb ripped through a rural home, police had no idea who was responsible. A lot number on a 9-volt battery and the remnants of a mailing label found on a hard drive led investigators to who sent the bomb and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man is found dead in his home, and his ex-wife has a perfect alibi. To determine time of death, investigators need to know when the victim ate his last meal. An endocrinologist, a forensic botanist, and a short-order cook answer their question.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When hunters found a skull in a Texas canyon, police found bits of clothing, small bones and a strand of hair. A forensic artist reconstructed her face. Now all they had to do was find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Emergency dispatch received a call from a man who said his girlfriend shot and killed herself. The autopsy revealed that the gunshot wound was not self-inflicted and the evidence on her body would give police a golden opportunity to catch her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful _ he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the first time animal DNA was used to solve a criminal case. When the body of Douglas Beamish's estranged wife Shirley Duguay was discovered, authorities linked 20 cat hairs found on her jacket to a cat owned by Beamish's parents.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Residents of Noel, Missouri were stunned to learn that their bank had been robbed and the bank president was missing. His body was later found floating in a lake, securely bound to a chair with duct tape.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe

programme.desc: Jonathan, Lisa and Annmarie survey the economy and global markets with daily conversations with leaders and decision makers, from Wall Street to Washington and beyond, to cover the latest in business, investment and geopolitics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Tech
programme.desc: Bloomberg Tech is the only daily live technology program with a focus on breaking news, market-moving reporting and analysis of global technology companies and stories. The program brings the audience interviews from the biggest names in the business, offering in-depth analysis and critical insights.

programme.title: Bloomberg ETF IQ
programme.desc: Bloomberg ETF IQ focuses on the opportunities, risks and current trends tied to the trillions of dollars in the global exchange traded funds industry. Bloomberg's Matt Miller, Scarlet Fu and Eric Balchunas are joined by leaders in this market, providing critical intelligence to finance advisers and investors of ETFs.

programme.title: Bloomberg: The China Show
programme.desc: From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors insight into the world's second-biggest economy, delivering in-depth discussions with newsmakers.

programme.title: Insight with Haslinda Amin
programme.desc: In a volatile and unpredictable world, the show will be the definitive guide for the global news audience to get the complete picture on the biggest story of the day. With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: En qué trabaja el muchacho
programme.desc: Un humilde niño sufre una terrible tragedia en su familia, que deja paralizado a su hermano, por lo que consigue un trabajo como sicario.

programme.title: Por Tu Culpa
programme.desc: Sara conoce a dos hombres en la playa y se enamora de ambos. La situación se complica cuando descubre que son hermanos y debe elegir entre ellos.

programme.title: Dulce obsesión
programme.desc: Cuando una estudiante se muda con una familia a la Ciudad de México, un romance con el padre, un vínculo con la hija y la tensión con la madre conducen a un secreto que sacudirá a la familia.

programme.title: El regreso del cara de chango
programme.desc: Un hombre jura vengar la muerte de su primo y para ello deberá liberar a un famoso reo que conoce al asesino.

programme.title: Sicario: ejecución de mando
programme.desc: El Gato, un asesino a sueldo legendario, cree haber encontrado a su sucesor en un joven asesino a sueldo con un estilo similar al suyo.

programme.title: Bajadores de narcos
programme.desc: Un exmilitar descubre botín en una casa de tráfico. Junto con sus vecinos, lo roba, pero a medida que pasa el tiempo se suceden muertes misteriosas.

programme.title: Señora del Destino
programme.desc: Maria do Carmo es una madre de cinco hijos que triunfó en la vida con mucha lucha y tesón pero que todavía tendrá una batalla que luchar: obtener el cariño de su hija quien fue secuestrada cuando era una recién nacida.

programme.title: La tierra prometida
programme.desc: Historia bíblica que sigue a Josué mientras lidera a los hebreos hacia Canaán. Josué enfrenta diversos desafíos, incluyendo la oposición de Samara, quien está enamorada de él.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: El Comendador alimenta la esperanza de libertad de Isaura. Muleka descubre que su papá fue asesinado y André le hace una promesa sobre el Kilombio. Henrique se entera que Isaura podría estar enamorada de un hombre que fue esclavo.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Una historia que se desenvuelve a mediados del siglo XIX en Brasil y relata la vida de Isaura, una esclava mestiza, hija de la esclava del Comendador y el capataz de la hacienda.

programme.title: Hijos del Monte
programme.desc: Cinco hermanos viven una vida tranquila en el fundo Rinconada del Monte, encargándose de cuidar del próspero fundo, legado de su padres, pero todo cambia cuando se lee el testamento, iniciándose una ruptura y el inicio de una nueva historia.

programme.title: La tierra prometida
programme.desc: Historia bíblica que sigue a Josué mientras lidera a los hebreos hacia Canaán. Josué enfrenta diversos desafíos, incluyendo la oposición de Samara, quien está enamorada de él.

programme.title: Pasta
programme.desc: A Yoo-kyung le resulta difícil decidir si ir a Italia a recibir formación de cocina, porque significaría que estaría separada de Hyeon-uk.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: Abraham y sus seguidores llegan a Egipto y le piden al general que los deje establecerse en sus tierras. Gracias a su padre, Abraham tiene buenas referencias frente al faraón. Egipto parece el lugar indicado para el crecimiento de Abraham.

programme.title: Señora del Destino
programme.desc: Maria do Carmo es una madre de cinco hijos que triunfó en la vida con mucha lucha y tesón pero que todavía tendrá una batalla que luchar: obtener el cariño de su hija quien fue secuestrada cuando era una recién nacida.
